intro: Pavetta tendagurensis, commonly known as the East African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Africa, including Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and elliptical in shape, with a smooth upper surface and hairy underside. The flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and have five white petals, often accompanied by yellow stamens.
